description: sincere +‎ -ly, from Latin sincērus (“pure, clean, sound”).

adverbs.description: sincerely (comparative more sincerely, superlative most sincerely)

entries.meaning: In a sincere or earnest manner; honestly.
examples: I sincerely hope they make it home safely.

entries.meaning: (US) A conventional formula for ending a letter, used when the salutation addresses the person for whom the letter is intended by his or her name.
examples: Please consider the proposal carefully and let me know what you decide.Sincerely,Fred
